work.name: ZipRecruiter
work.summary: Tech Lead for the ZipIntro product, leading development across multiple technology stacks and achieving significant improvements in user metrics and performance.
highlights: Tech Lead for the ZipIntro product, managing multiple apps written in Typescript, Ruby, React, Go and Perl
Developed the SMS feature for ZipIntro surpassing OKR for adoption and no-show rates
Launched the Employer Bridge app, aiding in the migration away from the monolith
Addressed and resolved an ElasticSearch outage and contributed to the knowledge transfer
Led the redesign and release of the Candidate page, increasing user adoption from under 10% to above 20% for the Stages feature
Rewrote the my-jobs page in React and Go decreasing initial page load times from 1.57 seconds to 552ms

work.name: ZipRecruiter
work.summary: Led major revenue-generating initiatives and automation projects.
highlights: Led PriceIncrease 168, projecting a revenue increase of several million dollars
Implemented the "Training Provided" project, projecting over $1 million in first-year revenue
Developed a tool for automated cookie reviews, saving significant time across teams

work.name: Prime Trust
work.summary: Led development of white-label financial products.
highlights: Lead the creation of our white-label Debit Card issuance API product

work.name: Prime Trust
work.summary: Developed core infrastructure and testing improvements.
highlights: Built an error handling system with static codes integrated with API documentation generation
Built a proof of concept using the Karate test automation tool for integration tests
Worked on custom web framework built using Ruby, Sequel, Roda and Trailblazer

work.name: ScaleFactor, Inc.
work.summary: Full-stack engineer developing financial products and integrations.
highlights: Part of a small team that developed Scalefactor Charge Card in 9 months using Ruby on Rails, Redis and Sidekiq
Designed and implemented major portions of the data architecture for the lending product in Postgres
Built a major portion of the front-end application using Ember JS, JavaScript (ES6) and SCSS
Worked on the Ruby gem that interacts with the external Galileo Lending API
Implemented the front-end and most of the back-end for the Gusto integration
Created and managed the onboarding flow for new developers
Worked with AWS technologies including S3, Lambda, EC2, Elastic BeanStalk, ECS and Lex
Followed Agile Methodology with 1-week sprint cycles

work.name: Bouquet.ai
work.summary: Led TypeScript migration and implemented core infrastructure improvements.
highlights: Coordinated the migration of existing codebase from Javascript to Typescript
Worked extensively in NodeJS (ES6), EJS, HTML, CSS
Persisted conversation flow data on MongoDB
Implemented data visualizations using HighCharts
Implemented logging and alerting via the Elastic Stack (‎Elastic Search, ‎Kibana, ‎Logstash)
Help set up the code deployment pipeline using Jenkins, Docker, AWS (EC2)

education.description: Project Based, Peer to Peer Computer Science School. Projects are completed with limited access to C Standard Library and a rigorous peer review process.
